import sketches1Img from "./img/root/sketches1.jpg"; import sketches1MobileImg from "./img/root/rootMobile/sketches1_mobile.jpg"; import sketches2Img from "./img/root/sketches2.jpg"; import sketches2MobileImg from "./img/root/rootMobile/sketches2_mobile.jpg"; import sendMessageImg from "./img/root/sendMessage.jpg"; import sendMessageMobileImg from "./img/root/rootMobile/sendMessage_mobile.jpg"; import messagePageImg from "./img/root/messagePage.jpg"; import messagePageMobileImg from "./img/root/rootMobile/messagePage_mobile.jpg"; const RootProject = () => { return ( Root Project | Portfolio {/* 상단 이미지 섹션 */}

Root

ROOT is a family social communication application that allows users to engage, connect, and share updates or news with their families abroad. Designed for easier accessibility for seniors.

Tools Used: Figma, Protopie
Team Mijili | SFU | IAT339

View Prototype
View Promo Video
{/* 상세 설명 섹션 */}

Idea & Interaction Framework

Based on our interviews and research, our primary users are seniors over 75 with family members abroad. This app helps them feel connected to family despite geographical and physical limitations.

Persona

Persona 01: Judy

Judy is a 75-year-old single woman with children living in Japan and Seattle. She feels isolated due to the pandemic and has trouble connecting with her family due to technology limitations.

Persona 02: Jason Smith

Jason is 85, living in Vancouver, with children in various time zones. He hopes to have a messaging function that allows him to send scheduled messages at appropriate times.

Sketches

These initial sketches include main home, profile, and album functionalities, with options for viewing family members' locations, time zones, and weather.

Storyboard

Our storyboard illustrates a scenario where Judy uses ROOT to schedule a message to her daughter Mika, ensuring she receives it at the appropriate time in Japan.

Design Variations

Different design variations were explored, focusing on color schemes and button sizes for seniors' ease of use. The final design uses larger buttons and simplified interactions.

Style Guide

The style guide includes the Roboto font for readability, a warm orange primary color for friendliness, and larger icons and text for accessibility.

User Study Plan

Our usability study was conducted with six participants, focusing on think-aloud protocols and post-study interviews to refine ROOT's features for family communication.

Procedure

The user study was divided into four stages: introduction, pre-test interviews, testing tasks, and post-test interviews.

Design Issues

Design issues identified include the need for consistent group chat layouts, visibility improvements for features, and clearer indicators in the memory page.

Improvements

Improvement 1

Redesigned group chat layouts and a clearer creation option were implemented to resolve inconsistencies.

Improvement 2

The messaging interface was redesigned with time selection improvements for user convenience.

Improvement 3

Replaced calendar icons with profile images for clarity on the memory page.

); }; export default RootProject;
